There was an error when trying to access %1$s\'s resource files. I am very sorry for the inconvenience! You can either try to restart your device (seriously: It helped on a Nexus 4), or you can download the all-in-one-version of %1$s, where this problem cannot occur, from %2$s

Access to the station has been declined
Hey rookie! Clear the launch area immediately.
Clear the launch area immediately, or we will open fire.
The fabled planet Raxxla is the home of all Elite pilots in the universe. It provides retreat and peace for them along with a portal to another universe.

A prototype model of the new top-secret military ship, the Constrictor, has been stolen by unknown agents from a Navy research base. Due to the capabilities of this ship the Galactic Co-operative of Worlds is offering a large reward to anyone who destroys the Constrictor before it falls into enemy hands.

For full mission briefing, please report to the space station at this system here. Due to the sensitive nature of this assignment, it is vital that you keep details of the Constrictor to yourself. Good luck Commander!

The Galactic Intelligence Agency (GIA) reports that the Constrictor made an intergalactic jump out of this system a short while ago. It is suggested that you make the same jump and report to the nearest space station for further details.
GIA reports that after causing havoc, the Constrictor made a hyperspace jump out of this system. The deep space tracking station suggests that its destination is this system here.

The Galactic Co-operative of Worlds is forever in your debt, oh mighty trader! As a small token of our appreciation, please accept a reward of 10,000 credits for your trouble. While I have your attention, the Galactic Police would like me to remind you about the small matter of several hundred unpaid parking tickets!

The Navy has managed to obtain rare blueprints of a Thargoid battle ship giving details of the drive and weapon systems. These documents need to be taken as soon as possible to the main naval base in orbit around the planet shown here. The enemy is unaware that we have these documents so the journey should proceed without any trouble.
The documents have been placed in your cargo hold. Your ship has been fully serviced and is ready for takeoff. Good luck Commander!

We are (again) forever in your debt for bringing these very important documents to us. As a reward we have fitted your ship with the latest naval energy unit which will recharge your energy banks at twice the normal rate. In light of the number of \'incidents\' you get yourself involved in, you will probably find it rather useful. The GIA also wishes to apologize for the security leak to the Thargoids. They are carrying out intensive investigations and the culprit will soon be found.
Sorry - there is no one here to trade with.
Warning - the sun in this system is going supernova. You are advised to leave as soon as possible.

Please help us! Everyone else has fled the supernova but we were left behind when our shuttle was damaged by an asteroid. We managed to limp back to the space station but face certain death if we don\'t leave soon. There are only a few of us. We could fit in your cargo hold.

Thank you, you will be well rewarded by our government. I\'m afraid that we\'ve had to dump any cargo you had to get us all in. If you could just drop us off at the nearest star system that\'ll be fine.
Thank you for carrying us to safety. Please accept a selection of precious Zanxian gem stones as a token of our appreciation.
I hope you die a horribly long and lingering death at the hands of a slimy green lobstoid, that\'s if you\'re now blown to bits by our sun!

Warning to all Traders: Reports have been coming in from Traders in this sector of an unknown hostile ship with awesome capabilities. Rumours suggest that this ship is fitted with a device which causes on-board computer systems to malfunction.

The Galactic Intelligence Agency reports that a nearby system has been invaded by Thargoid ships and that the space station has been captured. All available forces are being gathered to destroy the invading force. The space station has become the main Thargoid headquarters and it\'s from this base that the planetary attack is being mounted. The space station must be destroyed - no matter what the cost!
Thanks for destroying the Thargoid base. A new device was salvaged from one of the Thargoid ships which we have fitted to your ship. The device appears to jam ECM broadcasts.

You have proven yourself worthy and now you have finally come to a place where you can rest and find peace. We welcome you here. Take a look around and enjoy Raxxla. You are free to leave at any time, of course, but most pilots stay. There just isn\'t anything new out in the universe.
Congratulations, Commander. Now you are truly among the Elite.
%s - %d%s available. Average Price: %s (Tap again to buy)
Sorry - that item is out of stock.
Sorry - we don\'t have that much in stock.
Sorry - you don\'t have enough credits.
Sorry - you don\'t have enough room in your hold.
The fee for assisted docking is %s. Accept?
All lasers (of that type) already mounted.
Fuel system already full (%d.%d light years).
Mission #5 - Destroy the Alien Space Stationp
Are you sure you want to delete Commander %s?
Are you sure you want to delete the selected Commanders?
Are you sure you want to load Commander %s?
Are you sure you want to overwrite Commander %s?
Unfortunately, %s has crashed. I am sorry for the inconvenience :(
Please send the error cause detailed below with button \'%s\',
it helps tracking down the problem.
Neither the subject nor the content does not contain any personal information
only the error itself and the environmental data.
The code sequence in the subject is formed from the error message,
please do not change it, it helps in recognizing the more times sent identical errors.
Planet %s is in Galaxy %d. You are currently in Galaxy %d.
Sorry, %s does not work here, anymore.
No, %s does not work here, either. Sorry.
The Master Control Program is at your service.
Do you really want to quit %s?
You seem to be new to %s, Commander. Would you like to visit the Training Academy now?
If you want to visit the Academy later, you can find it at the bottom of the Command Console. Before you launch, it might be a good idea to review your Control Settings. Would you like to do so, now?
Use this option, if Accelerometer controls don\'t work for you (Nexus 10 for example).
Note however that alternative Accelerometer controls only work sitting up (Sorry!).
Please review your Control Settings before we begin your training.
Color scheme file is skipped, error: %s
No enemies at all. Only Vipers attack if your legal status requires it.
Very few enemies. At most 2 at a time. No Thargoids.
Few enemies. At most 3 at a time. Thargoids are rare.
Normal number of enemies. At most 4 at a time. Some Thargoids.
Enemies appear frequently. At most 6 at a time. Thargoids are abundant.
Armageddon. Be warned: Frustration level is extremely high.
Select the group of buttons you\'d like to change.
Select the button you\'d like to change.
Are you sure you want to quit this tutorial?

Welcome to your basic training, nugget. I am Commander Quelo and I\'ll make sure that you can handle that Cobra once you get out of my training. Remember kid: Owning a Cobra does not give you the ability to fly it. I will give you that ability.
What you see on the screen in front of you is the status screen. You can check all the details of your Cobra.
It tells you where you are currently docked and where you\'re headed.
Watch that \'Condition\' read-out: If it turns to red, there might be a chance for you to make a kill and get some bounty -- or get killed in the process.
Your legal status should be clean at all times, unless you plan to trade in illegal goods or can\'t tell friend from foe and destroy a friendly Python while targeting a Krait.

Your rating tells others how dangerous you are. A fresh-meat like you should be concerned with surviving out there in space. It\'s a hard life outside and only few of us survive. However, in the unlikely event that you should prove less inept than usual, there might be a slim chance your rating will improve to Mostly Harmless and beyond, but you need to kill other ships for that, kiddo.
The fuel indicator tells you how many light years you can travel in hyperspace,
and finally you can check your current balance by looking at the cash read-out.

One more thing about the status screen is that it shows the equipment of your ship. You start with a measly pulse laser, which couldn\'t even scare my granny, and three Lance and Ferman missiles. You may want to improve on that ASAP, greenhorn.
On the right hand side, you find the command console. Put your finger on it and drag it all the way up.
Fascinating, eh? This console allows you to interact with the station you are docked with and do all the trading and improving your ship -- so you don\'t even have to leave your ship anymore.
Want to see what there is to do in the console? Ok, so go ahead, kiddo. Push the "Buy" button on the console. If you can\'t find it, that\'s because you have to drag the console back down first.
I see, you have got that one right. Now, for today\'s final exercise, try to find the "Galaxy" button and marvel at the vastness of the universe you and I are living in.
Great. You have shown the ability to do as you are told. I like that. My dog does what I tell him. Maybe I should introduce the two of you. Remind me to do this.
Now, go have a good think about what you\'ve learned and come back when you\'re ready for more, nugget.
Ah, I see you\'re back. Think you\'re ready for more basics? Ok, so first, open the Buy screen again. You remember how to do that, don\'t you?

Here, you can see all the goods that are offered on the station you\'re docked with. The price of the good is given below the good and right next to the trade item, you can see how much of it is available. If you can\'t figure out what a symbol represents, just tap it, and a description will be displayed at the bottom of the screen.
Oh, don\'t be shy, try it: Tap one trade item once. Come on.
See? That wasn\'t so hard after all, was it? Now, if you tap it again, and the item is available, you can buy some.
Let\'s try that: Tap on the symbol for food.
No, I told you to tap on the food-icon, that\'s the one in the upper left corner, wet-nose.

Now you need to enter the quantity: How much do you want to buy. Let\'s not overindulge ourselves here: Although this is a simulation only, and nothing will really be added to your cargo bay, enter a 1 followed by OK.

I don\'t know if you failed basic reading, but it sure looks like that you fleshy-headed mutant. Type a 1, that\'s the number in the first column, third row, followed by OK; that\'s the third column, fourth row button.
Good. You have now bought 1 ton of food and your account has been reduced by the price of food. Now go to the inventory screen and see how that ton of food is displayed there.

See? You can also see at the bottom of the screen that you now have less cargo space available. You start with a 20t Cargo hold in a Cobra Mk III. I sure hope you\'ll upgrade that soon. Now, what about selling? To sell something, go to the inventory screen and tap the item you want to sell twice. Easy, right? Go ahead, do it...

Yeah. See. Now you sold the food back. But what\'s that? You lost money in the process! That\'s the standard fee for selling anything at a space station. It will automatically be removed from your price. So you better make sure that you sell your goods at a higher price than you bought them. Don\'t worry, though, cub, this was only a simulation. We did not take anything from your account. Understood all that? -- I didn\'t think so. So go back and think about everything I told you today and then come back when you\'re ready for more.
Back so soon? Ok, I\'ll make this lesson brief and simple. Consider it a favor, especially for you.
Go to the Equipment screen now.

Yes, here we are. This one works just as the buy screen: Tap an item once to get information about the item and tap it again to install it on your ship -- provided of course you have enough credits. I have drained your hyperspace fuel as a training exercise, so go ahead. Buy some fuel.
Fuel, nugget. Fuel! That\'s the upper left icon. Tap it twice. Is it really that hard for you?

Wow. I\'m impressed. You have now refueled your ship. Well done! You can tap on the other icons if you must, but come back tomorrow for another training session. Today, I am busy. I need to go to that amazing -- um -- shipyard. Now.

Wonderful morning, eh, rookie? I have a bunch of information for you today. So wipe the sleep from your face and pay attention! You have seen the Galaxy screen already, but today, I\'ll tell you more about it. First: Open it.

The white cross you see indicates your current position. The red circle around it, shows how far you can travel with your current fuel. You can zoom in by pressing two fingers on the screen and move them apart. Do that until you can see the names of the systems appear.

See how it moved the map back to your current location? Helps newbies like yourself not to get lost so easily... Did you notice the different colors of the star systems? These colors indicate the economy of the system. It ranges from poor agricultures in grey to rich industrials in blue. In case you forget, however, you can switch to the planet screen to get more information on the selected planet. Do that now.
No, I told you to switch to the planet screen, wet-nose. Try again.

Here on the planet screen, you\'ll see all the relevant information for a planetary system: The name, its economy, its government, and the tech level, which tells you what kind of equipment you\'ll be able to buy at that system. You\'ll also have information on the inhabitants of that planet, which you should read carefully, so you can trade successfully and not risk insulting a feline by not smelling enough -- not that I think you\'d have a problem with that particular requirement, nugget.
Now that you have gathered information on the planet, switch to the local screen.
No, I told you to switch to the local screen, wet-nose. Try again.

The local screen is the same as the galaxy screen but it shows only a small region around your current location if accessed. You can zoom out, though. Just hold two fingers on the screen and move them together. Do it now.

Good. Now, you know everything about navigation. Or almost: Remember that the system you select is always your destination system. If you launch and engage hyperspace, you\'ll end up in that system -- if you\'re not intercepted by Thargoids that is.

Scared, nugget? Well, you should be. Life as a pilot is hard, dangerous, and hardly rewarding. Still, we get to see rare sights, if we master control of our ship and survive assaults. Do you have it in you? We are soon going to find out: Next lesson, I\'ll start the flying instructions. Until then: Think hard if this is really what you want. If not, don\'t show up next time. Your secret is safe with me. I won\'t tell a soul about your fears. Trust me.
Welcome Back, \'Commander\'. Well? How does it feel to be in the Cockpit of a Cobra, hm?
Don\'t worry, rookie, you are in the safe zone around Lave space station, no one will attack you here.
The safe zone is a zone around a space station where the police Vipers will watch over you.
You can see that you have reached a safe zone by the large S in the bottom right corner of your radar.
So now you can relax and enjoy the view of Lave right in front of you. Isn\'t it beautiful?
If you want to look around, you can change the display to show the right, rear, or left view out of your ship. To look right,
tap the right half of your radar.
swipe your finger from right to left over the screen.
No. Look to your right. Remember: %s
Yes. Just like that. You can now see that the green indicator of your radar is on its right half: You are looking right. To look behind you, %s
tap the bottom half of your radar.
swipe your finger from right to left over the screen again.
tap the bottom half of your radar.
Good. You are now looking at the Coriolis station in orbit around Lave. That\'s where you\'ll eventually have to dock, but we\'ll keep that for a later lesson.
You can look left, too, I suppose you know how to do that on your own, don\'t you? Go ahead, look left...
tap the left half of your radar.
swipe your finger from right to left over the screen again.
Ok, so now you can look around. Good. The green area on your radar tells you in which direction you are looking, and the purple bar on the radar is the space station.

It is now almost in the center of the radar, which means that you are very close to it. In fact, the space station is a little behind you. You can see that more clearly, if you increase the zoom factor of the radar.
tap the green area on your radar.
Good. You can enhance the zoom factor even more, by tapping again. If you tap once more, the zoom factor will be back to normal.
We will get back to the radar in more detail in the next lesson, for now, let\'s focus on the gauges you see next to your radar.
On the left hand side, you have your front and aft shield gauges.
When they are depleted, the next laser hits are going to damage your hull and the energy bars on the lower right, numbered 1 through 4 are affected.
If you lose your last bit of energy, the Cobra is destroyed, so you want to watch out who\'s in the vicinity, kiddo.
Below the aft shield on the left hand side is the fuel gauge. It only depletes in hyperspace travel and tells you how far you can jump.
Next is the cabin temperature meter. If you go fuel scooping near the sun, you want to watch that gauge closely. If it gets too hot, your Cobra will explode.
Next is the laser temperature. If you fire too much, the laser becomes too hot and you will have to wait until it cools down again.
Below that, there is the altitude meter. It shows, how high you are above the planet. Do not try to land on alien planets, kiddo, the locals don\'t appreciate that.
Finally, at the bottom of the left hand side is your missile indicator. Your Cobra has four missile slots. If a slot is empty, the circle representing the slot is black.
If a missile is in the slot, the circle is green, if the missile is targeting, it is yellow and if it is locked, it becomes red.
On the right hand side, you can see your current speed, your current roll, and your current pitch.
Did you wonder about the four buttons on the top of your screen? We won\'t touch them right now, but let me tell you what they do:
The button on the top left fires your laser. %s
Tap it once and the laser starts shooting. Tap it again and the laser stops.
Of course, this only works if you have a laser equipped in the current view.
The other button on the left lets you target a missile. Whatever target will be in your crosshairs, will be targeted. Tap the button again to fire a locked missile.
The upper button on the right hand side will take you to the station interface, you can use that to select a hyperspace target or check local market prices.
Of course, you can\'t sell or buy anything while in space. You need to dock first.
The lower button on the right takes you to hyperspace and you will get out at your selected destination -- unless you are hijacked by Thargoids, that is.
Some pretty heavy stuff, hm? I bet you have a lot to think about. So let me dock this ship for you now and you can then rest a little and come back when you\'re ready for more...
Good Morning kiddo, we\'ll do some real flying today, so you\'d better pay attention...
The horizontal bars on the radar tell you the direction in which an object is, vertical bars indicate the difference in altitude relative to your ship.
Too difficult for you, rookie? Let me show you:
See those two bars? The yellow bar is a target which is in front of you, to your left, and above you.
The blue bar is a target behind you, on your right, and below you.
But wait, there\'s more. Did you notice the small radar to the right and above your main radar?
Inside the safe zone, the small radar shows the position of the space station.
If the dot in the radar is red, the station is in front of you, if it is green, it is behind you.
Outside the safe zone, the dot represents the planet: Red means the planet is in front of you, green means, the planet is behind you.
But why don\'t you try to get the blue target in front of you. You will also see how the smaller radar will change.
I will let you control the pitch and roll of your Cobra. To control pitch, %s
tilt your screen towards you to go up and away from you to go down.
tap the upper part of the control pad to go down and the lower part to go up.
tap the arrow pointing up to go down and the arrow pointing down to go up.
rotate the left side of your screen away from you to roll left and rotate it towards you to roll right.
tap the left part of the control pad to roll left and the right part to roll right.
tap the arrow pointing left to roll left and the arrow pointing right to roll right.
Now, are you ready to take command of the Cobra? Try to bring the blue target into the crosshairs in front of you.
Not bad for a rookie. You sure took your time, you will have to master the controls in order to survive, wet-nose.
Why don\'t you get the yellow target in front of you?
Ok, I think you\'re getting the hang of this. Now, let\'s approach the yellow target, ok?
To increase speed, slide your finger up on the screen. To reduce speed, slide it down.
If you tap on the target, the computer will identify the target for you.
Go ahead, fly a little closer.
Good. That\'s close enough. Now, for a little target practice:
We are using simulated lasers, so don\'t worry, you cannot harm anyone.
Do try to destroy the target in front of you, though. It will be affected by the simulated laser. To engage the laser, press the button on the upper left.
Now for the remaining target: Approach the blue target.
Ok, you\'re close enough, now tap the missile button on the left once to target the missile.
Get the blue target into your crosshairs, so that the missile indicator turns red.
And then tap the missile button again.
Now let\'s return to the station, shall we?
Remember, the docking bay of a Space Station is always oriented towards the planet.
So pick a point between the planet and the station and approach the station from there.
Let me help you: See the new red target? Approach it.
Good. Now turn around so that you face the station.
And then dock: Keep the docking bay horizontal and approach the station carefully.
This will be the last thing I teach you, today. If you manage to dock successfully, you can officially call yourself \'Commander\'. Good luck, wet-nose.
Welcome back, Commander! A fair landing you produced there. I\'m proud of you!
You are now ready for more advanced controls, but we need to be out in space for those.
Therefore, when you activate the hyperspace, you will reach a simulated space region a little off of Lave. Go there, now. Activate the hyperspace drive.
You have now reached a space region outside Lave, you can see clearly that you are outside the safe zone.
Now, in order to reach Lave station, you have to fly towards the planet. So bring the circle in the small radar to your front. Remember: The circle is red once the planet is in front of you.
Good. Now accelerate to maximum speed by sliding your finger up.
Ok. If you traveled at this speed, it would take forever to reach Lave, but did you notice that a new button appeared once you reached maximum speed?
This is the torus drive button and it will allow you to utilize the engine boosters.
It only works, however, if you are already flying with maximum speed and no other ships are in the vicinity. Try it. Activate the torus drive.
Wow... That was fast, wasn\'t it? Why did we stop?
Usually the torus drive is interrupted, if you are too close to the planet or the star, or an enemy ship appears waiting to get a shot at you.
In this simulation, I killed the torus drive.
And now, you\'re about to make a kill. An enemy ship will appear soon, and I want you to destroy it.
It will attack you, but it is a relatively harmless and slow Adder. There is a slim chance, though, that it might destroy you.
In that case: You pay the drinks tonight and we\'ll try again tomorrow.
Hey not bad... You destroyed the Adder. And it released a couple of Cargo Canisters. You can see them on the radar as purple bars.
Remember: If you tap on a target on your screen, it will be identified by the computer.
Your simulated Cobra is equipped with a fuel scoop, so you may collect those Cargo Canisters and their contents are then added to your inventory.
To successfully do that, ram a Cargo Canister with the lower part of your Cobra, where the Fuel Scoop is installed. Go ahead, now.
Oh no. You have destroyed the Cargo Canister. Remember: You must touch it with the lower part of your Cobra.
This is all I can teach you, really. As a last training exercise, dock at Lave station. You are on your own. Good luck out there, Commander.
The Blue Danube now playing in your head.
%s v%s - by Philipp Bouillon and Duane McDonnell. You have played for %s, %s, and %s and you have scored %d points.
